title: Augusta County: H. Brown to Elen Martin, January 27, 1865
summary: Brown discusses the food and conditions at camp, the health of soldiers and prisoners, and his experiences preaching to both. He also notes that morale is rising, as a result of the apparent newfound humility of President Jefferson Davis.
keywords: Camp Life, Church/Religious Activity, Desertion/Leave, Medicine/Hospitals, Military Authority, National Government, Prisons/Prisoners, American Civil War
